text: So I’m looking to scale up my career (I mean, who isn’t?) as a copywriter and editor. I adore editing, and I’d love to take on more clients for that. But there’s a definite ceiling on how much editing work I can take on at one time. My company also doesn’t offer much in-department ascension beyond manager for listing copywriters. I’d have to switch departments, hop into HR, or completely pivot to coding. Or, ya know, leave. :woman-shrugging: Any advice for an editor looking to jump to the next level?

text:
There was a good thread the other day (or week? what is time anyway) about elevating from content making to content strategy.

The planning and strategy side of the content biz is definitely a pathway that can still keep you close to editing, but you'll need to upskill into thing like:

• general business strategy and where content fits in that
• content distribution
• people management, possibly
If you want to stay as close to editing as possible, then you may be able to find gigs that are looking for more of a managing editor/editor-in-chief role for a large content production ecosystem. Those roles would also come with a heavy ole dose of people management though.
